name: VERSES AI Inc.
title: Founder-to-Operator Transition: R&D to Commercial Pivot

classification.classificationRationale: Decision tree: Formal AI unit=YES (VERSES is an AI company building the Genius platform) → Publishes research=YES (active intelligence research) BUT primary output shifting to products → Builds products from AI=YES → M5a (products stay in parent). Temporal orientation: explicit phase transition from exploration (founder-led R&D) to execution (operator-led commercialization). Low confidence: single source (press release), thin structural detail.

description: VERSES AI experienced a classic founder-to-operator transition in February 2026. Founder/CEO Gabriel Rene, co-founder/Brand Ambassador Dan Mapes, and Chief Accounting Officer Kevin Wilson all resigned from positions and the board on February 10, 2026. David T. Scott was appointed Interim CEO, bringing a 30-year career spanning AWS, Twitter, and AT&T. Scott immediately articulated an explicit pivot from R&D exploration to commercial execution, targeting financial services as the initial market for VERSES' Genius agentic enterprise intelligence platform. The pattern is clean: exploration-stage founders depart, execution-stage operator arrives, and the organizational mission narrows from broad R&D to specific commercial targets.

observableMarkers.reportingStructure: Interim CEO David T. Scott (AWS/Twitter/AT&T background). Founder CEO Gabriel Rene departed.
observableMarkers.timeHorizons: Near-term revenue focus — 'driving near-term revenue beginning with financial services.'
observableMarkers.decisionRights: Centralized under new interim CEO. Board restructured with founder departures.

quotes.speaker: David T. Scott
quotes.quote: Our focus now is straightforward and transparent: converting our R&D into commercial products, executing a disciplined go-to-market strategy, and driving near-term revenue -- beginning with opportunities in the financial services sector.

layers.label: Founder Departure + Commercial Pivot
layers.summary: Founder CEO Gabriel Rene, co-founder Dan Mapes, and CAO Kevin Wilson all resigned. David T. Scott (AWS/Twitter/AT&T) appointed Interim CEO. Explicit pivot from R&D exploration to commercial execution targeting financial services.

sources.name: GlobeNewsWire — VERSES AI Announces Management Changes

openQuestions: What is VERSES AI's actual team size and organizational structure post-transition?
How does the Genius platform work and what stage of development is it?
Will the financial services focus succeed in generating near-term revenue?
Is this a genuine pivot or a prelude to wind-down/acquisition?
taxonomyFeedback: Clean example of the founder-to-operator pattern that often accompanies the exploration-to-execution transition. The new CEO's first statement is almost a textbook articulation of temporal ambidexterity: 'converting R&D into commercial products.'
Small company but the pattern is analytically valuable as a reference case for how AI startups manage the research-to-product transition.
